attributes.action: allow schools to take their students abroad on school trips
attributes.additional_details: I’m a student at a high school who’s ski trip had been cancelled due to the corona virus. The trip is in a few week and everyone going was very excited. We all still want to go. I could also name a number of other schools that are very disappointed in what had happened. Skiing in particular is a trip that happens rarely and me being in year 11 leaving my school this year this is the last time i can go on one as a school trip. However i’m no longer allowed to. Me and people at my school are very upset
attributes.background: allow schools to take their students abroad for school trips that are in full swing and have been payed for.

rejection.details:
Decisions about whether school trips go ahead are a matter for individual educational institutions.

The Government has advised schools and colleges against all overseas trips for children under 18 until further notice.

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/government-advises-schools-and-colleges-to-cancel-overseas-trips

The Government has now also ordered the closure of all schools to most pupils from Friday 20 March.

https://www.gov.uk/government/speeches/pm-statement-on-coronavirus-18-march-2020

The Foreign & Commonwealth Office (FCO) has also advised British people against all non-essential travel worldwide.

https://www.gov.uk/guidance/travel-advice-novel-coronavirus

You could start a petition calling on the Government to reimburse schools and students for the cost of any visits that have had to be cancelled because of coronavirus.
